speaker: CELIA
text: I pray thee, Rosalind, sweet my coz, be merry.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Dear Celia, I show more mirth than I am

speaker: ROSALIND
text: mistress of, and would you yet I were merrier?

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Unless you could teach me to forget a banished

speaker: ROSALIND
text: father, you must not learn me how to remember

speaker: ROSALIND
text: any extraordinary pleasure.

speaker: CELIA
text: Herein I see thou lov’st me not with the full

speaker: CELIA
text: weight that I love thee. If my uncle, thy banished

speaker: CELIA
text: father, had banished thy uncle, the Duke my father,

speaker: CELIA
text: so thou hadst been still with me, I could have taught

speaker: CELIA
text: my love to take thy father for mine. So wouldst thou,

speaker: CELIA
text: if the truth of thy love to me were so righteously

speaker: CELIA
text: tempered as mine is to thee.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Well, I will forget the condition of my estate

speaker: ROSALIND
text: to rejoice in yours.

speaker: CELIA
text: You know my father hath no child but I, nor

speaker: CELIA
text: none is like to have; and truly, when he dies, thou

speaker: CELIA
text: shalt be his heir, for what he hath taken away from

speaker: CELIA
text: thy father perforce, I will render thee again in

speaker: CELIA
text: affection. By mine honor I will, and when I break

speaker: CELIA
text: that oath, let me turn monster. Therefore, my sweet

speaker: CELIA
text: Rose, my dear Rose, be merry.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: From henceforth I will, coz, and devise

speaker: ROSALIND
text: sports. Let me see—what think you of falling in

speaker: ROSALIND
text: love?

speaker: CELIA
text: Marry, I prithee do, to make sport withal; but

speaker: CELIA
text: love no man in good earnest, nor no further in

speaker: CELIA
text: sport neither than with safety of a pure blush thou

speaker: CELIA
text: mayst in honor come off again.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: What shall be our sport, then?

speaker: CELIA
text: Let us sit and mock the good housewife Fortune

speaker: CELIA
text: from her wheel, that her gifts may henceforth be

speaker: CELIA
text: bestowed equally.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: I would we could do so, for her benefits are

speaker: ROSALIND
text: mightily misplaced, and the bountiful blind woman

speaker: ROSALIND
text: doth most mistake in her gifts to women.

speaker: CELIA
text: ’Tis true, for those that she makes fair she scarce

speaker: CELIA
text: makes honest, and those that she makes honest she

speaker: CELIA
text: makes very ill-favoredly.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Nay, now thou goest from Fortune’s office to

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Nature’s. Fortune reigns in gifts of the world, not in

speaker: ROSALIND
text: the lineaments of nature.

speaker: CELIA
text: No? When Nature hath made a fair creature,

speaker: CELIA
text: may she not by fortune fall into the fire?

speaker: CELIA
text: Though Nature hath given us wit to flout at Fortune,

speaker: CELIA
text: hath not Fortune sent in this fool to cut off the

speaker: CELIA
text: argument?

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Indeed, there is Fortune too hard for Nature,

speaker: ROSALIND
text: when Fortune makes Nature’s natural the

speaker: ROSALIND
text: cutter-off of Nature’s wit.

speaker: CELIA
text: Peradventure this is not Fortune’s work neither,

speaker: CELIA
text: but Nature’s, who perceiveth our natural wits too

speaker: CELIA
text: dull to reason of such goddesses, and hath sent

speaker: CELIA
text: this natural for our whetstone, for always the dullness

speaker: CELIA
text: of the fool is the whetstone of the wits.

speaker: CELIA
text: How now, wit, whither wander you?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Mistress, you must come away to your

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: father.

speaker: CELIA
text: Were you made the messenger?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: No, by mine honor, but I was bid to come

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: for you.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Where learned you that oath, fool?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Of a certain knight that swore by his

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: honor they were good pancakes, and swore by his

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: honor the mustard was naught. Now, I’ll stand to it,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: the pancakes were naught and the mustard was

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: good, and yet was not the knight forsworn.

speaker: CELIA
text: How prove you that in the great heap of your

speaker: CELIA
text: knowledge?

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Ay, marry, now unmuzzle your wisdom.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Stand you both forth now: stroke your

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: chins, and swear by your beards that I am a knave.

speaker: CELIA
text: By our beards (if we had them), thou art.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: By my knavery (if I had it), then I were.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: But if you swear by that that is not, you are not

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: forsworn. No more was this knight swearing by his

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: honor, for he never had any, or if he had, he had

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: sworn it away before ever he saw those pancakes or

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: that mustard.

speaker: CELIA
text: Prithee, who is ’t that thou mean’st?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: One that old Frederick, your father, loves.

speaker: CELIA
text: My father’s love is enough to honor him.

speaker: CELIA
text: Enough. Speak no more of him; you’ll be whipped

speaker: CELIA
text: for taxation one of these days.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: The more pity that fools may not speak

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: wisely what wise men do foolishly.

speaker: CELIA
text: By my troth, thou sayest true. For, since the little

speaker: CELIA
text: wit that fools have was silenced, the little foolery

speaker: CELIA
text: that wise men have makes a great show. Here

speaker: CELIA
text: comes Monsieur Le Beau.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: With his mouth full of news.

speaker: CELIA
text: Which he will put on us as pigeons feed their

speaker: CELIA
text: young.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Then shall we be news-crammed.

speaker: CELIA
text: All the better. We shall be the more

speaker: CELIA
text: marketable.—Bonjour, Monsieur Le Beau. What’s

speaker: CELIA
text: the news?

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: Fair princess, you have lost much good sport.

speaker: CELIA
text: Sport? Of what color?

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: What color, madam? How shall I answer you?

speaker: ROSALIND
text: As wit and fortune will.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Or as the destinies decrees.

speaker: CELIA
text: Well said. That was laid on with a trowel.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Nay, if I keep not my rank—

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Thou losest thy old smell.

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: You amaze me, ladies. I would have told you of

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: good wrestling, which you have lost the sight of.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Yet tell us the manner of the wrestling.

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: I will tell you the beginning, and if it please

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: your Ladyships, you may see the end, for the best is

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: yet to do, and here, where you are, they are coming

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: to perform it.

speaker: CELIA
text: Well, the beginning that is dead and buried.

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: There comes an old man and his three sons—

speaker: CELIA
text: I could match this beginning with an old tale.

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: Three proper young men of excellent growth

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: and presence.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: With bills on their necks: “Be it known unto

speaker: ROSALIND
text: all men by these presents.”

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: The eldest of the three wrestled with Charles,

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: the Duke’s wrestler, which Charles in a moment

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: threw him and broke three of his ribs, that there is

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: little hope of life in him. So he served the second,

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: and so the third. Yonder they lie, the poor old man

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: their father making such pitiful dole over them that

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: all the beholders take his part with weeping.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Alas!

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: But what is the sport, monsieur, that the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: ladies have lost?

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: Why, this that I speak of.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Thus men may grow wiser every day. It is

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: the first time that ever I heard breaking of ribs was

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: sport for ladies.

speaker: CELIA
text: Or I, I promise thee.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: But is there any else longs to see this broken

speaker: ROSALIND
text: music in his sides? Is there yet another dotes upon

speaker: ROSALIND
text: rib-breaking? Shall we see this wrestling, cousin?

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: You must if you stay here, for here is the place

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: appointed for the wrestling, and they are ready to

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: perform it.

speaker: CELIA
text: Yonder sure they are coming. Let us now stay

speaker: CELIA
text: and see it.

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: Come on. Since the youth will not be

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: entreated, his own peril on his forwardness.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Is yonder the man?

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: Even he, madam.

speaker: CELIA
text: Alas, he is too young. Yet he looks successfully.

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: How now, daughter and cousin? Are

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: you crept hither to see the wrestling?

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Ay, my liege, so please you give us leave.

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: You will take little delight in it, I can

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: tell you, there is such odds in the man. In pity of the

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: challenger’s youth, I would fain dissuade him, but

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: he will not be entreated. Speak to him, ladies; see if

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: you can move him.

speaker: CELIA
text: Call him hither, good Monsieur Le Beau.

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: Do so. I’ll not be by.

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: Monsieur the challenger, the

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: Princess calls for you.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: I attend them with all respect and duty.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Young man, have you challenged Charles the

speaker: ROSALIND
text: wrestler?

speaker: ORLANDO
text: No, fair princess. He is the general challenger.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: I come but in as others do, to try with him the

speaker: ORLANDO
text: strength of my youth.

speaker: CELIA
text: Young gentleman, your spirits are too bold for

speaker: CELIA
text: your years. You have seen cruel proof of this man’s

speaker: CELIA
text: strength. If you saw yourself with your eyes or knew

speaker: CELIA
text: yourself with your judgment, the fear of your adventure

speaker: CELIA
text: would counsel you to a more equal enterprise.

speaker: CELIA
text: We pray you for your own sake to embrace your

speaker: CELIA
text: own safety and give over this attempt.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Do, young sir. Your reputation shall not

speaker: ROSALIND
text: therefore be misprized. We will make it our suit to

speaker: ROSALIND
text: the Duke that the wrestling might not go forward.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: I beseech you, punish me not with your hard

speaker: ORLANDO
text: thoughts, wherein I confess me much guilty to deny

speaker: ORLANDO
text: so fair and excellent ladies anything. But let your

speaker: ORLANDO
text: fair eyes and gentle wishes go with me to my trial,

speaker: ORLANDO
text: wherein, if I be foiled, there is but one shamed that

speaker: ORLANDO
text: was never gracious; if killed, but one dead that is

speaker: ORLANDO
text: willing to be so. I shall do my friends no wrong, for

speaker: ORLANDO
text: I have none to lament me; the world no injury, for

speaker: ORLANDO
text: in it I have nothing. Only in the world I fill up a

speaker: ORLANDO
text: place which may be better supplied when I have

speaker: ORLANDO
text: made it empty.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: The little strength that I have, I would it

speaker: ROSALIND
text: were with you.

speaker: CELIA
text: And mine, to eke out hers.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Fare you well. Pray heaven I be deceived in

speaker: ROSALIND
text: you.

speaker: CELIA
text: Your heart’s desires be with you.

speaker: CHARLES
text: Come, where is this young gallant that is so

speaker: CHARLES
text: desirous to lie with his mother Earth?

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Ready, sir; but his will hath in it a more

speaker: ORLANDO
text: modest working.

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: You shall try but

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: one fall.

speaker: CHARLES
text: No, I warrant your Grace you shall not entreat

speaker: CHARLES
text: him to a second, that have so mightily persuaded

speaker: CHARLES
text: him from a first.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: You mean to mock me after, you should not

speaker: ORLANDO
text: have mocked me before. But come your ways.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Now Hercules be thy speed, young man!

speaker: CELIA
text: I would I were invisible, to catch the strong

speaker: CELIA
text: fellow by the leg.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: O excellent young man!

speaker: CELIA
text: If I had a thunderbolt in mine eye, I can tell who

speaker: CELIA
text: should down.

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: No more, no more.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Yes, I beseech your Grace. I am not yet well

speaker: ORLANDO
text: breathed.

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: How dost thou, Charles?

speaker:
LE
               
              BEAU
text: He cannot speak, my lord.

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: Bear him away.

speaker:
DUKE
               
              FREDERICK
text: What is thy name, young man?

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Orlando, my liege, the youngest son of Sir

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Rowland de Boys.
